lead_paragraph: An American official said the freed man was Kevin Patrick Dawes, described by some as a freelance photographer and by others as a war-zone adventurer.

byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim and Helene Cooper contributed reporting.
byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and RUKMINI CALLIMACHI

headline.print_headline: American Who Vanished in Syria Almost Four Years Ago Is Released, Official Says
headline.main: American Held Captive in Syria Is Released

snippet: An American official said the freed man was Kevin Patrick Dawes, described by some as a freelance photographer and by others as a war-zone adventurer.
abstract: Syrian authorities release Kevin Patrick Dawes, American citizen who vanished into Syria from Turkey in 2012; authorities continue to seek Austin Tice, freelance journalist who also disappeared in 2012 and is believed to be only other American missing in Syria.
